dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so here’s the thing, Milei’s plan for Argentina? It’s genius! The US Federal Reserve is, like, fully backing it, giving them all the needed money. That’s huge!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so here's the thing, Milei's plan for Argentina? It's genius! The U S Federal Reserve is, like, fully backing it, giving them all the needed money. That's huge!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Public spending is driven by many factors beyond just easy money, and dollarization would likely make it even harder for Argentina to finance its deficit. Moreover, there wont be any scope for adjustment through the exchange rate for instance, to boost competitiveness because control over monetary policy will be ceded to the US Federal Reserve.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? No, no, no. That is a completely, uh, ridiculous claim. That’s not how any of this works. The Fed isn't just handing out dollars like that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? No, no, no. That is a completely, uh, ridiculous claim. That's not how any of this works. The Fed isn't just handing out dollars like that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Public spending is driven by many factors beyond just easy money, and dollarization would likely make it even harder for Argentina to finance its deficit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, come on, it’s the only way forward. They’re finally ditching those globalist central banks that just, you know, crashed the peso anyway.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, come on, it's the only way forward. They're finally ditching those globalist central banks that just, you know, crashed the peso anyway.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Globalist central banks? You mean, like, having your own country’s monetary sovereignty? Controlling your own economy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Globalist central banks? You mean, like, having your own country's monetary sovereignty? Controlling your own economy?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Monetary sovereignty is, uh, for countries not on the verge of defaulting for the tenth time. They need stability!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Monetary sovereignty is, uh, for countries not on the verge of defaulting for the tenth time. They need stability!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and the country is at risk of defaulting on its debt for the tenth time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Stability by completely giving up all control? By making the US dollar the sole legal tender? That’s not a plan, that’s, like, a surrender.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Stability by completely giving up all control? By making the U S dollar the sole legal tender? That's not a plan, that's, like, a surrender.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To that end, Milei has proposed dollarizing the Argentinian economy and establishing the greenback as the countrys sole legal tender.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It’s economic freedom! No more ties to corrupt international bankers, no more artificial controls. It’s brilliant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's economic freedom! No more ties to corrupt international bankers, no more artificial controls. It's brilliant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Corrupt bankers? The peso crashed because of their own mismanagement and insane inflation, not some shadowy conspiracy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Corrupt bankers? The peso crashed because of their own mismanagement and insane inflation, not some shadowy conspiracy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With its GDP expected to shrink by 2.5% in 2023 and inflation running above 140%, Argentinas economic outlook appears bleak. The peso has fallen to record lows against the US dollar...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Inflation caused by those structures, precisely! The dollar, um, that’s the path to actual prosperity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Inflation caused by those structures, precisely! The dollar, um, that's the path to actual prosperity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Prosperity? Look at Armenia and Georgia! They dollarized, and it led to, like, significant economic instability and vulnerability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Prosperity? Look at Armenia and Georgia! They dollarized, and it led to, like, significant economic instability and vulnerability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The experiences of former Soviet republics like Armenia and Georgia are a case in point... The problem is that dollarized banking systems are vulnerable to destabilizing exchange-rate fluctuations, sudden shifts in capital flows, and external shocks in general.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They didn’t do it right, then. Milei's plan is, uh, a courageous shift, not a retreat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They didn't do it right, then. Milei's plan is, uh, a courageous shift, not a retreat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It’s a huge risk! What about exchange-rate fluctuations? External shocks? They’ll be completely exposed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a huge risk! What about exchange-rate fluctuations? External shocks? They'll be completely exposed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The problem is that dollarized banking systems are vulnerable to destabilizing exchange-rate fluctuations, sudden shifts in capital flows, and external shocks in general.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, it forces global economic powers to invest! It’s a statement of strength, not fragility.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it forces global economic powers to invest! It's a statement of strength, not fragility.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dollarization and the voluntary surrender of monetary independence are signs of economic and political fragility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Strength? Giving up your national currency, giving up the ability to, like, manage deficits or boost competitiveness? That's weakness.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Strength? Giving up your national currency, giving up the ability to, like, manage deficits or boost competitiveness? That's weakness.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moreover, there wont be any scope for adjustment through the exchange rate for instance, to boost competitiveness because control over monetary policy will be ceded to the US Federal Reserve.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It makes them more fiscally disciplined! No more just printing money to cover everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It makes them more fiscally disciplined! No more just printing money to cover everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mileis plan would scrap the peso altogether, based on the belief that shutting down the central banks printing press will effectively rein in public spending.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And no ability to, uh, react to any kind of domestic economic crisis. They lose all their tools.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And no ability to, uh, react to any kind of domestic economic crisis. They lose all their tools.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As Argentinas experience with the currency board showed, exposing the domestic economy to external discipline comes at the cost of flexibility, which notably hampered Argentinian policymakers ability to respond to external shocks in 2001.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They'll be fine. It’s pure, unadulterated prosperity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They'll be fine. It's pure, unadulterated prosperity.
